**Elon Musk Tops Global Rich List, Pavel Durov Emerges as Russia's Biggest Gainer in 2025**
According to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index, the world's 500 richest individuals were ranked at the end of the third quarter of 2025. Elon Musk (USA), CEO of Tesla and SpaceX, leads the list with a net worth of $459 billion, a $26.7 billion increase year-to-date. Larry Ellison (USA), founder and largest shareholder of Oracle, ranks second with $340 billion, a $148 billion year-to-date gain. Mark Zuckerberg (USA), founder of Meta (banned in Russia), ranks third with $258 billion, up $51 billion year-to-date. Twenty Russian billionaires were included in the list, with their collective wealth increasing by $19.69 billion in 2025. This growth is attributed to rising commodity prices and a global technology boom, which significantly boosted the value of shares in both Western tech firms and Russian assets. Pavel Durov, founder of Telegram, contributed nearly a quarter of the $19.69 billion increase. His wealth stems from stakes in companies including Nordgold, 'Siburan', 'Lenta', TUI, 'Siliye Mashiny', USM Holdings (containing 'Metallloinvest', 'Udokan Copper', 'Megafon'), Novatek (24.6%), Sibur (30.6%), Renova Group (12.58% RusAl, 18.98% Oerlikon, 48.82% Sulzer), Polus (gold mining), Novatek (23.5%), Sibur (17%), Stroytransgaz (53%), Transoil (80%), Norilsk Nickel (37%), Rosbank (45%), T-Bank (35%), Lukoil (12%), Millhouse Capital, Evraz Plc, Yandex, Norilsk Nickel, Renaissance Insurance, NLMK, First Port Company, Monaco FC, and LetterOne Holdings (pre-2022). All data is sourced from Bloomberg Billionaires Index and Forbes.
